37.str2: To be more than conqueror, prevail mightily. From huper and nikao; to vanquish beyond, i.e. Gain a decisive victory.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

37.str2: To love, wish well to, take pleasure in, long for; denotes the love of reason, esteem. Perhaps from agan; to love.

37.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.

From dunamai; force; specially, miraculous power.

39.str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor. Of uncertain affinity; other or different.
From ktizo; original formation.

39.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
39.str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.
From chora; to place room between, i.e. Part; reflexively, to go away.

39.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
39.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From agapao; love, i.e. Affection or benevolence; specially a love-feast.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

39.str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
